Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: Expanded my knowledge of asl. Learned new grammar and vocabulary.
I improved on my vocabulary, my understanding of conjunctions,  deaf history, and the linguistic components of ASL.  I feel like my overall fluidity also improved.
A deeper understanding of ASL grammar and Deaf culture.
This course taught me how to converse and communicate in american sign language.
My fluency in American Sign Language increased significantly. I learned much more about the structure and grammar of ASL, as well as deaf history and culture.
Course was fun with a reasonable amount of work. Could be improved with more structure to the course and clearer learning goals.

The biggest strength of the class in my opinion was that it met five days a week enabling me to practice my signing everyday, which had a marked effect on my fluency and skill level. The weakness of the class in my opinion was that it was a little unclear in terms of how the content was organized, although this was the first year so some growing pains are expected.
Absolutely! ASL is such an engaging and intriguing language to learn. Jessica does an incredible job getting students involved and truly inspires you to learn more about ASL and Deaf culture!
Yes! Jessica is great and always available to help. I learned a ton and my asl improved a lot.

I would absolutely recommend this class! Despite being a level 2 class of a pilot program, there is something to be learned for people at all levels.  It is a very fun and social class, which is always engaging.
Definitely! The professor is wonderful and the class was interactive and highly informative.

I would absolutely recommend this class to another student on the basis that they are interested in learning sign language. Otherwise, taking this class would not make sense. It is a fairly chill class that allows you to practice an interesting language.

Absolutely. The instructor is amazing, and the course itself was fun, engaging, and informative. ASL is so different from any other language, and it requires you to think in a completely different way than you do in any other Yale course/subject.
